wordpressPost.title: Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50 😊
wordpressPost.content:
Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50 😊

 

As I was flipping through my Sirius radio channels while driving, I heard a voice say:

“Your fifty-eight years old.  Stay in your marriage.  At your age, you won’t be able to find anyone else and being alone is far worse at your age then the pain of staying in your marriage.”

Of course, I thought this was both ridiculous and intriguing at the same time so I stayed tuned to the station, and it was the famous Dr. Laura talking to a woman that called in about her husband having multiple affairs and her question was “Should I leave him or stay?”

To be fair to Dr. Laura, she was probably telling the lady what she wanted to hear because she had a vibe of being afraid to take the next step and leave.

Dr. Laura explained that the fact that she had grown kids and that her husband would probably get remarried to a younger girl and then all of the families including her, most likely she’d be alone, would have to gather at family functions, and, this would be painful.  Maybe more painful than getting a divorce.

The lady was a bit taken back, but ultimately she agreed because I guess she needed affirmation in her decision to stay.

After listening to that conversation, I turned the station to Spa music which helps me to relax and keep my mind at peace.  But, not today.  I was bothered by the radio conversation because I wonder if all of us women of a certain age have to worry about whether or not our options will change.  And according to Dr. Laura and society, it’s not an if, it’s a certainty that they will.

Maybe I have my fears because my mothers biggest fear was that she was going to die alone.  I always say that we create what we fear.  After several failed marriages, she did, in fact, die alone.

However, dying alone is not my biggest fear.  I fear that I will get old and my husband will leave me for a thirty-year-old, and I will have no relevance.  I know, dumb things that we sometimes tell ourselves 🙁

Just so you know, I don’t sit around worrying about this, but it does make one a little off when at a certain age, we walk into a room, and it’s like we have disappeared into a crowd. Or, like last night, I stood at the bar trying to get a glass of wine, and they looked right passed me.

Maybe my real fear is getting old?

Later that day, I met my daughter for dinner, and I explained the radio conversation, and she just rolled her eyes and said, “Mom that’s not how it is.”

Although I would like to believe her, I also had to set her straight and explain that this is, in fact, is the way that it is.  Men can date half their age and women can barely get a date after fifty or sixty let alone beyond.

Which brings me to a time when my husband and I were eating dinner, and I pointed to a few beautiful women, and I said:

“If we ever got a divorce, one of those women would be your next wife.”  He quickly replied with “I’m not going to date women our age if we got a divorce.”

 I was mortified because for one, I needed him to at least lie to me and say “Yeah” and two, I didn’t need confirmation on what I already feared.

A friend of mine said she was playfully joking with her husband and she said:

“Okay if you get a girlfriend then I’ll go find a guy too.”

 He replied “Oh yeah?  Well, I have more value than you at your age.  The joke went from funny to not so funny, super quick!

I was listening to Kathleen Turners interview yesterday with Vulture Magazine, and she said that she once got a script and when she read it, it said, that she was going to be thirty-seven years old and “STILL SOMEWHAT ATTRACTIVE!”  

Geeze, if we are only somewhat attractive at thirty-seven because that’s when we’re old, how are women over fifty supposed to feel?  I am not implying that we have to be what others think as beautiful but, we have to feel good in our skin.

I know too that it’s not about how we look, it’s about the connections in life that we make.  It’s not about things it’s about living the beautiful life that we are given.  I know that life is short and if God forbid I am diagnosed with a terminal illness, none of this crap that I’m writing about even matters!

So I am not going to insert the word but here because writing the above paragraph just put it all in perspective, whereas when I run it through my mind, it wasn’t so clear.

Life is not about fearing and worrying that someone that is supposed to love you and be faithful to you is going to trade you in for a newer model.  It’s about trusting and loving that person with all that you have.  We can’t fully love if we are in fear of loss.

The truth is, we are all going to be alone one day.  Whether it’s through death, divorce, or whatever.  Life has a beginning, a middle and an end.

No matter what, it’s important to live all three of these parts because while I was worried about stupid shit like getting old and younger women, the sun is starting to set in the third part of my life and there’s no time to waste 🙂

 

 

Marriage, Divorce, Single after 50!
